content: this legal text summarizes the progress of a divorce case between mr and mrs the parties have appeared before a notary and declared their capacity to perform legal acts they have read and agreed to a draft instrument for a mutual consent divorce the text provides details about their marriage children property and assets they have agreed on the settlement of property rights including the division of immovable property and debts provisions regarding the childrens residence parental responsibility and financial contributions have been made they have also agreed to open a joint bank account for childrens expenses arrangements regarding inheritance rights and the finality of the agreement have been made the text explains the procedure for filing for divorce and the tax implications the costs and fees related to the proceedings and notary fees are usually split equally but if one spouse is solely responsible for ending the proceedings they may need to reimburse the other spouse any costs related to acquiring a property will be borne by the respective person receiving it the parties are responsible for paying their lawyers fees they can choose where the case will take place and have the right to choose another notary if there is a conflict of interest the notary verifies their identities and provides them with a digital copy of the legal document a fee of 100â‚¬ must be paid to the notary the partners have signed the deed in the presence of a notary
